defs.docs: daemonize is a library for writing system daemons. Inspired by the Python library [thesharp/daemonize](https://github.com/thesharp/daemonize).

attributes.value: / daemonize is a library for writing system daemons. Inspired by the Python library [thesharp/daemonize](https://github.com/thesharp/daemonize).
/ The respository is located at https://github.com/knsd/daemonize/.

defs.docs: Unable to resolve group name to group id

defs.name: WritePid

defs.name: DaemonizeError
defs.value:
pub enum DaemonizeError {
    Fork,
    DetachSession(Errno),
    GroupNotFound,
    GroupContainsNul,
    SetGroup(Errno),
    UserNotFound,
    UserContainsNul,
    SetUser(Errno),
    ChangeDirectory,
    PathContainsNul,
    OpenPidfile,
    LockPidfile(Errno),
    ChownPidfile(Errno),
    RedirectStreams(Errno),
    WritePid,
    Chroot(Errno),
    __Nonexhaustive,
}

defs.name: User
defs.docs: Expects system user id or name. If name is provided it will be resolved to id later.

attributes.value: / Expects system user id or name. If name is provided it will be resolved to id later.

defs.docs: Expects system group id or name. If name is provided it will be resolved to id later.

attributes.value: / Expects system group id or name. If name is provided it will be resolved to id later.

defs.name: Stdio
defs.docs: Describes what to do with a standard I/O stream for a child process.

attributes.value: / Describes what to do with a standard I/O stream for a child process.
/ Fork the process in the background, disassociate from its process group and the control terminal.
/ Change umask value to `0o027`, redirect all standard streams to `/dev/null`. Change working
/   * change the pid-file ownership to provided user (and/or) group;
/   * execute any provided action just before dropping privileges.

defs.name: privileged_action
defs.value:
pub fn privileged_action<N, F: FnOnce() -> N + 'static>(Self, F)
-> Daemonize<N>
defs.docs:
Execute `action` just before dropping privileges. Most common usecase is to open listening socket.
 Result of `action` execution will be returned by `start` method.

attributes.value: / Execute `action` just before dropping privileges. Most common usecase is to open listening socket.
/ Result of `action` execution will be returned by `start` method.

defs.name: exit_action
defs.value: pub fn exit_action<F: FnOnce() -> () + 'static>(Self, F) -> Daemonize<T>
defs.docs:
Execute `action` just before exiting the parent process. Most common usecase is to synchronize with
 forked processes.
